page.title: 02CENTRAL REGIONAL HQ STIRLING
page.content: The baronial mansion, built by John Hay in 1885, for Peter Drummond was used by the Stirling County Council from the first world war.A new wing of offices was built from 1931-37.In 1972 one million pounds was spent on a new building, in the grounds of{Viewforth and this became{Central Regions {Headquarters}in 1975. James Anderson, Convenor and 33 Councillors lead a permanant staff of around 2000 employees. Departments included in Viewforth are 1. The Education dept. under Mr Ian Collie which controls 193 Schools and Colleges. 2.Finance which decides where the money will be spent 3. Computer section where facts and figures are stored 4. various other sections such as Planning, Architects Social Services and Public Relations. They also control departments outwith the main building.(L.ANDERSON,A.SMITH)
